_header: Lord whereto is this world so gay
Subjects: transitoriness, of world; possessions, worldly; world, untrustworthiness of; mutability
_description:
Translation of Cur mundus militat (Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, 3934) which precedes it (ff. 52v-53) — 40 lines in couplets

BLAdd60577.First Lines:
Lorde whereto ys this worlde soo gayeWhos blysse so soone ys shake
                    awaye…
BLAdd60577.Last Lines:
…In hevene thy wonnynge thou theke to makeHe ys wyse that cane
                    the worlde forsake
BLAdd60577.Facsimiles:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981.
